fields.content:
The Warranty Claim Process
General Warranty Information
The Insurance Process
General Insurance Claim Process

The Warranty Claim Process

  1. Customer detects fault and contacts dealership with a customer complaint.
  2. The dealership assesses the customer complaint and documents the claim in writing. The claim is forwarded to the Customer Assurance team at NAC.
  3. The Customer Assurance team receives the customer claim from the dealership and starts working with suppliers and contractors to identify the parts that needs replacement and the labour involved to carry out all necessary work. Once approval has been sough from all parties involved in the customer claim, the Customer Assurance team fills in a form to document parts and labour involved in the claim and staples approval documentation from suppliers/contractors to the form.
    An approval number is sent by the Customer Assurance team to the party that will carry out the repair work.
    KPI - maximum 7 days from Customer Assurance Team receiving warranty claim from dealership to sending approval number to repairer.
  4. The NAC Customer Assurance Team orders the necessary spare parts to carry out the repair work in Ostendo. All spare part orders are tagged "Spare parts" in Ostendo to separate them from general material orders. Once the spare part is delivered from the supplier to NAC, the Customer Assurance team ships the parts to the point of repair.
    KPI - maximum 7 days from spare part being ordered to being shipped.
  5. Once all necessary repair work has been carried out, the repair shop/dealership sends an invoice to the Customer Assuranc e team for payment. If the repairs were organised by the van owner, the van owner sends copies of all receipts to the Customer Assurance team for reimbursement.
  6. Upon receiving the invoice/receipts for repair work carried out, the Customer Assurance Team compares the actual cost with the initial quote. A costing spreadsheet is updated to keep track of all repair work. The invoice/receipts are attached to the initial quote and filed away. All incoming invoices are signed off by the Customer Assurance Manager. A copy of the invoice/receipts are attached to the approval of spend and submitted to the NAC Finance Team for payment.
  7. The NAC Finance Team pays/reimburses the repair shop/dealership/customer and oncharges any costs suppliers/contractors.

Contents

General Warranty Information

  • There is a 12 month warranty on the caravan and parts. However, there is a 2 year warranty on the fridge which is indicated in the van specification documentation handed to the caravan owner.
  • Contractors carrying out warranty work are:
    • Northern RV – Plumbing
    • CES – Electrical
    • Priority Maintenance – Roofing
  • Customer Assurance Team handles, on average, approximately 140 warranty claims per month.
  • Australia Post picks up spare part parcels on Tuesdays & Thursdays from NAC main office to be distributed to the repair centres carrying out the work. To keep the cost down, couriers are kept to a minimum. Postage costs for spare parts are currently posted to the same GL account as general postage fees and no reporting is provided to the Customer Assurance Team on the annual spend on postage/courier fees for Warranty work.

Contents

The Insurance Process

  1. The van owner dropps off van at Caravans on Cooper for Insurance claim assessment.
  2. Caravans on Cooper inspects the van and provides a quote for the work necessary to be carried out (both labour and parts). The quote is forwarded to the insurance company for approval. The insurance company may send an inspector to assess the van before approving the quote.
  3. Once the insurance company has approved the quote, Caravans on Cooper books a date at the NAC factory for work to be carried out.
  4. If the van owner wishes for any other work done on the van, the Customer Assurance Team organises a quote for the van owner for  the parts and labour.
  5. Van is repaired at the NAC factory by production staff. What is the process for organising parts required and how do we keep track of the labour costs?????
  6. Once all work has been carried out, the Customer Assurance Team provides the NAC Finance Team with all necessary information and paperwork to invoice Caravans on Cooper for the repairs.
  7. Caravans on Cooper, via the NAC Finance Team, invoices the insurance company for the insurance claim via EFTPOS or credit card.
  8. When the van in picked up by the owner, Caravans on Cooper, charges the customer for any extra work done that was not part of the costs incurred.

Contents

General Insurance Claim Process

Customer Assurance Team oversees the insurance claim work of approximately 3 vans/month.

Contents
fields.name: Warranty

fields.content:
Overview
Quote Creation
Pre-requisites
Steps
Quote Approval
Build Processing

Overview

Any caravan order at New Age Caravans will first be created as a Quote. Once a quote is approved by the relevant authority, it is classified as an Order, and a build can be started against it. This document will walk you through that process.

Contents

Quote Creation

Pre-requisites

The user should be logged in with one of the following roles:

  • National Sales Manager
  • Dealer Principal
  • Dealer Sales Rep

Steps

  1. Navigate to the Order Creation page by clicking Menu > Create Order.
  2. You will be presented with the New Quote page. You have the option to either create a Stock Order, or a Customer Order.



    For both types of orders, a dealership selection is required. The dealership list is available based on the user role:
     
    Role Access Level
    National Sales Manager Can select any dealership
    Dealer Principal Can only select from dealerships assigned to him
    Dealer Sales Rep Can only select from dealerships assigned to him
  1. Once you have filled in the required information, you can create an order by clicking either the Create Dealership Order or the Create Customer Order buttons.
  2. The systems saves the order with the Quote status, and presents you with the Caravan Details section. This section comprises three sub-sections:
  • Model & Series (selected initially)
  • Weight & Size
  • Features
  1. Unless you complete the Model & Series section, you cannot proceed to the subsequent sections. You are required to specify a model and a series, or alternatively get the model and series information from an existing order by specifying the customer name or the chassis number for that order. Clicking the Save and Proceed button will take you to the Weight & Size section.
  2. In the Weight & Size section, you have the opportunity to specify weight information about the caravan. After specifying that information, you are taken to the Features section by clicking the Save and Proceed button.
  3. The Features section allows you to specify the details of what goes into the caravan. The available choices are grouped in Categories. For each category, you can:
    • Specify a selection for each department in that category. Some departments have only one option available, hence no selection is available and the only option is displayed for information purposes.
    • Specify any of the available Extra items. These items are not variations or upgrades on existing items, but are add-ons to the default set of items available in each category.
    • Make one or more special feature requests. Each such request can be made against a department, and allows you to specify a description and a customer cost.
    • Specify one or more production notes. These notes have no bearing on pricing, and are meant to provide information to the production team.

You should also note the following regarding the Features section:

  • Any changes to the item selections are saved automatically and immediately in the system i.e. there is no need to press some additional Save button.
  • When making a selection, some automated system rules may be applicable. For example, making one selection can automatically force-change one or more selections in the same or a different category.
  1. In addition to managing the caravan specification, the Features section makes the following three action buttons available to you:
    • Display Totals: Clicking this button results in a pop-up dialog box that displays the cost, wholesale and retail price of standard caravan features, upgrades, extras and special features, along with the total sum. The cost and wholesale price columns may not be visible to certain user roles based on their access level in the system.
    • Show Special: Pressing this button allows you to assign a Show Special to the order. Note that this show special needs to be selected from the home page in order for it to be available for assignment.
    • Print Specs: Pressing this button opens a new tab that displays the Specification sheet in printable format.

Contents

Quote Approval

Once the initial data for a quote is specified, it is ready to be approved for Order and Build processing. The first step is to request quote approval. For this purpose, the Request to Place Order button is made available in the top right area of the Order page. The following users have access to that button:

  • National Sales Manager
  • Dealer Sales Rep
  • Dealer Principal

Pressing this button takes the quote into the "Approval Requested" stage. A quote in this stage can only be approved by the following user types:

  • Dealer Principal: for quotes pertaining to his dealerships only
  • National Sales Manager: for all quotes

Once a dealer principal or national sales manager approves a quote, it becomes an order for a physical caravan build.

Contents

Build Processing

Once an order is approved, a variety of user roles can contribute to the build process. There is a sequential order to the available actions i.e. some actions can be performed only after others have been completed. The following table lists the available actions and the corresponding role access in order of availability:

Order of Availability Action Permitted Roles
1 Specify Deposit National Sales Manager, Dealer Principal, Dealer Sales Rep
1 Set Chassis No. Scheduler
2 Set Delivery Date Scheduler
3 Appoint Drafter Principal Drafter
4 Modify Customer Plan Principal Drafter, Drafter (own)
Modify Factory Plan
Modify Chassis Plan
5 Modify Contract National Sales Manager, Dealer Principal (own dealerships), Dealer Sales Rep (own)
6 Appoint VIN No. Quality Control
Appoint GE Release No. Accountant / CFO
Appoint Floor Plan No.
Modify Delivered by Scheduler, Production Manager
Modify Warranty start date Scheduler
Modify Pickup date

All the activities pertaining to the build processing of an order are logged in an order history. There is also a facility to upload a document  along with a description, against an order.

Contents
fields.name: Order

fields.content:
Overview
Model Selection
The Model Editor
Cloning a Series

Overview

The Model editor allows you to edit in detail the feature availability for series within a model. It also allows you the create a new series by cloning an existing one. The following roles have access to this page:

  • Master Admin
  • Model Manager

Contents

Model Selection

The list of models in the system appear as a horizontal listing at the top of the page. Click on a model in order to edit feature availability for Series within that model.

Contents

The Model Editor

The model editor consists of an accordion group, with each accordion panel corresponding to an Item Category in the system. Within a category panel, there is another accordion group, with each accordion panel corresponding to a department. The actual items are listed inside the department panels.

For each item, you can specify the availability type for a model series. The available options are:

  • Standard: this will be one of available options that incur no additional cost
  • Upgrade: this will replace a standard selection and will result in a change in the caravan price
  • Not Used: this item is not available for installation in this series
  • Optional Extra: this item is available as an add-on to the existing set of items available in this series
  • Selection: like Standard, except that it is selected by default

In addition, you can check the Is Visible checkbox for each item and series. This indicates whether the item will be visible in the spec sheet for a caravan based on this series.

Note that any changes you make in this interface are synchronized and saved automatically i.e. you do not need to press a Save button to commit your changes.

Contents

Cloning a Series

In order to clone a series, click the Clone Series button that appears next to the Model listing. This will show a pop-up that allows you to specify a Series to clone, and which model that series should reside in. Clicking the Clone button would create a new Series in that model.

Contents
fields.name: Model

fields.content:
Overview
Filtering Orders
Selecting an Order to Manage

Overview

This page lists all the orders in the system and allows you to filter orders as well as select them for viewing and modification. The following roles have access to this page:

  • Scheduler
  • Principal Drafter
  • Drafter
  • National Sales Manager
  • Dealer Principal
  • Dealer Sales Rep
  • Production Control
  • Quality Control
  • Production Manager
  • Purchasing Officer
  • Accounts

Contents

Filtering Orders

At the top of the page there is a filter text box which allows you to filter an order based on the Customer name. By typing in that text box and pressing the enter button, the Order listing can be shortlisted.

Contents

Selecting an Order to Manage

You can view and modify an order by clicking the Manage link next to an order.

Contents
fields.name: Order Listing

fields.content:
Overview
The Landing Page
Entering Basic Details
Selecting a Model
Selecting a Series

Overview

This is a wizard like interface that allows a user to place an order interactively over a series of screens. The following roles have access to this page:

  • National Sales Manager
  • Dealer Principal
  • Dealer Sales Rep

Contents

The Landing Page

The landing page for the showroom interface comprises a splash screen with the Create Quote button. Clicking this button leads you to the next screen where you can enter basic customer details.

Contents

Entering Basic Details

Here you can enter the following basic details about the customer:

  • First Name
  • Last Name
  • Email
  • Phone Number

Clicking the Continue button will take you to the next page, where you can select a model

Contents

Selecting a Model

On the model selection page, you will be presented with a set of logos corresponding to the models available at New Age caravans. Simply click an image to enable the selection of the series options on the same page. You can then select a series to proceed to the next page.

Contents

Selecting a Series

On the series selection page, you are asked to confirm your model and series selection. Selecting your series choice again will take you to the Orders page, where you can edit the features available for this order.

For further information, please see the Orders help section.

Contents
fields.name: Showroom

fields.content:
Overview
Generating a Report
Explanation of the Report
Report Export Options

Overview

The bill of materials page allows you to generate a comprehensive listing of materials required for orders within a date range. The following roles can access this page:

  • National Sales Manager
  • Dealer Principal
  • Dealer Sales Rep

Contents

Generating a Report

You can generate a bill of materials report by specifying a start and end date, and pressing the Generate Report button.

Contents

Explanation of the Report

The report shows two seperate listings.

  • The first listing details the orders who's order dates like between the date range specified.
  • The second listing consists of a tabbed panel listing the materials required to construct the builds in the first list, divided between the tabs based on where New Age carvans sources its materials from. These sources are:
    • Ostendo
    • Factory
    • Stock
    • Chassis

Contents

Report Export Options

The bill of materials report can be exported in one of the following two formats:

  • Ostendo: a special flat file format that is compatible for uploading into the Ostendo system
  • CSV: a plain text file that can be opened and processed in Excel or other spreadsheet applications

Contents
fields.name: Bill of Materials

fields.content:
Overview
Shortlisting the Recipients
Share Image Gallery with Lead
Add New Lead

Overview

The Leads Register page allows you to shortlist your customers and perform the following actions:

  • View and modify a lead
  • Add a new lead
  • Send a gallery share email to a lead who's caravan order is in the build stage

The following roles can access this page:

  • National sales manager
  • Dealer Principal (can view customers for own dealerships only)
  • Dealer Sales Rep (can view own customers only)

Contents

Shortlisting / Searching the Leads

The filter section available in the top area of the page allows you to shortlist customers by a combination of the following criteria:

  • Customer Id
  • Customer Name
  • Customer Status
  • State where the customer resides
  • The Model Series
  • Dealership

Clicking the Apply Filter button will refresh the page with the customer listing filtered accordingly.

Contents

Share Image Gallery with Lead

If the order of a lead is in the build stage, then a "Share Gallery" button appears against that lead in the Action column. Clicking this button will send out an email to that lead with a special URL, that allows her to access the image gallery associated with her caravan order.

Contents

Add New Lead

You can add a new lead by clicking the Add Lead button.

Contents
fields.name: Leads Register

fields.content:
Overview
Shortlisting the Recipients
Email Templates
Composing an Email
Attaching a file
Email Send Options
Now
Later
As a Test

Overview

The Email broadcast page allows you to shortlist your customers and send an identical email message to all of them with certain options available. The following roles can access this page:

  • National sales manager
  • Dealer Principal (can view customers for own dealerships only)
  • Dealer Sales Rep (can view own customers only)

Contents

Shortlisting the Recipients

The filter section available in the top area of the page allows you to shortlist customers by a combination of the following criteria:

  • Customer Id
  • Customer Name
  • Customer Status
  • State where the customer resides
  • The Model Series
  • Dealership

Clicking the Apply Filter button will refresh the page with the customer listing filtered accordingly.

Contents

Email Templates

You can select one of the existing email templates to compose your message, or specify the subject and body of the email yourself. There are three parameters that are currently supported in the email system. Embedding these parameters in the email body will result in their dynamic substitution for each recipient as the email is sent out. These parameters are:

%%lead_first_name%%
%%salesrep_name%%
%%dealership_name%%
 
You can also create a new email template by clicking the Manage Email Templates button.

Contents

Composing an Email

The email can be composed with rich text capability available for the email body. Once the email has been composed, it can be sent out using the Send Email button.

Contents

Attaching a file

You can attach a file to the email from one of the options available in the "Select an Attachment" dropdown box. Alternatively, you can upload a new attachment which will subsequently become available in the dropdown box. Only one attachment can be sent with an email.

Contents

Email Send Options

The following three options are available when sending an email:

Now

The email will be sent immediately after the Send Email button is pressed.

Later

With this option, you can specify a date and time when the email is sent. If the time specified is in the past, then the email is sent out immediately.

As a Test

Allows you to send the email to a test recipient, as opposed to the customers appearing in the lead listing.

Contents
fields.name: Email Broadcast

fields.content:
Overview
Report Selection Interface
Description of Reports
Sales Breakup Report
Warranty Approved to Close Time Trend Report
Lead Breakdown Report

Overview

The reports section allows you to browse and navigate all analytical reports in the system from a single page. The following roles have access to reports:

  • National Sales Manager
  • Dealer Principal
  • Dealer Sales Rep

Contents

Report Selection Interface

When generating a report, the user is able to specify the report type, and the start and end date parameters. A report is generated accordingly by pressing the Generate Report button.

Contents

Description of Reports

Sales Breakup Report

The Sales breakup report shows two charts, breaking up sales figures over time by individual sales reps and dealerships respectively. Each chart additionally plots a line for the aggregate sales count. The vertical axis denotes the number of caravans sold.

Contents

Warranty Approved to Close Time Trend Report

This report gives a summary of warranty claim response rates by plotting the number of claims that each took a certain number of days to process. All duration figures are duly represented in the chart for the selected time range.

Contents

Lead Breakdown Report

This report shows three pie charts that breakup the lead distribution by the following critera: Source of Awareness, Caravan Model, and Caravan Model type.

Contents
fields.name: Reports

fields.content:
Overview
Content Access

Overview

This page allows you to download marketing material from a central repository.

Contents

Content Access

Only marketing staff members have access to this page.

Contents
fields.name: Marketing Materials
